data.title: Denis Wick Products
data.text:
Tommy Meares (Trombone/Vocals) was member of Clarence Clemons & the Red Bank Rockers, and has performed with Southside Johnny & The Asbury Jukes, Bruce Springsteen, Max Weinberg, Gary U.S. Bonds, Bonnie Raitt, 10,000 Maniacs, The Temptations, The Coasters, Little Anthony and the Imperials, Bobby Bandiera, Eric Lindell, The Soul Project, Bonerama, Dirty Dozen Brass Band and many others.

He is currently playing with Jon Bonjovi & The Kings Of Suburbia as well as Felix Cavaliere &

» Read more about: Tommy Meares »

Naturally from Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico. He starts his studies on the trombone at the age of 12 on the school Josefa Pastrana in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico with the Prof. Wilson Mendez discovering his love for the music and the trombone. At the age of 14, he enters to the “Escuela Libre de Música Antonio Paoli” in Caguas, Puerto Rico where he continues his studies in the trombone with the Prof. Hector “Lutty” Maldonado.

» Read more about: Christian O. Alonso Rosa »

Luis is a well known musician and trombonist from the city of Cali-Columbia where is has been based for more than 18 years. He studied at the conservatoire of fine arts at the age of 16. University was very much the springboard to be part of one of the greatest salsa orchestras of all time in Columbia.

He has learnt from many of the great musical masters and this inspired Luis in 2014 to record his first album entitled “Ayer Perdi”.

» Read more about: Luis Camilo Lopez »

Dave Miller was born in Waukegan, Illinois, a Chicago suburb on Lake Michigan. His father was a trumpet player in the late 40’s and early 50’s. His love of music had an enormous effect on Dave. In his youth, Dave’s father would play records of Dizzy Gillespie, Maynard Ferguson, Louis Armstrong and Oscar Peterson, which the family would enjoy together.

At age 10 Dave chose to play the trombone. He played in band at school and took private lessons with local musicians including Scott Bliege,

» Read more about: Dave Miller »

Ulises is a Mexican musician, interested in trombone performance and other brass instruments. His career has developed into following a range of genres and ensembles. Whether in jazz, big band, chamber orchestra, chamber music, symphony orchestras, pop, folk music or performing as a soloist, Ulises is one of the most featured trombonists in Mexico City.

In 2007 he was awarded a student exchange scholarship to attend and study at Académie de Musique Rainier III in Montecarlo,

» Read more about: Ulises Nájera »

Musical studies for Charlie started at the age of 11. A graduate of the High School of Music & Art Studied at William Paterson College, Long Island University. After a 32 year hiatus, he graduated Cum Laude from CCNY in 2020 He was awarded a grant from the National Endowment of The Arts (1986) to study with Steve Turre and Benny Powell (two well-known jazz trombonists).

Charlie has performed with Ricardo Arjona, Frankie Ruiz,

» Read more about: Charlie Garcia »

Originally from Fresno, California, Raul Navarrette started playing trombone at the age of 9, and has been working as a New York City musician for the last 25 years. He has shared the stage with a wide range of artists exploring an array of genres along with artists from around the world in a variety of musical settings, locally and nationally.

Having received his master’s degree at The Aaron Copeland School of Music,

» Read more about: Raul Navarrette »

Principal Trombone Hammonds Brass Band – Co-Principal Trombone Black Dyke Band

Adam is a student at the Royal Northern College of Music, studying Performance under Gary McPhee. He is the Solo Trombone for The Hammonds Band and Co-Principal Trombone of The Black Dyke Band. Adam has held the Principal Trombone seat in the National Youth Brass Band of Great Britain since 2019.

A student of Dr Brett Baker, Adam has been playing Trombone since he was 7,

» Read more about: Adam Warburton »

Mark Ford is currently employed as a Head of Bands at St Leonards College, Melbourne. He has been a music teacher in Victorian Schools for over 30 years. His previous teaching appointments include Head of Bands & Brass at Wesley College Melbourne, Head of Brass and Band Studies at Westbourne Grammar School prior to joining the Royal Australian Navy Band as a full-time professional musician in 2001. He was commissioned as an officer in 2004.

» Read more about: Mark Ford »
